comments.author: Santhosh.Tuppad@gmail.com
comments.creator: Santhosh.Tuppad@gmail.com
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.1.16) Gecko/20101123 SeaMonkey/2.0.11
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.1.16) Gecko/20101123 SeaMonkey/2.0.11

I see that wherever there is required field, it is indicated with (required)text. But, I see inconsistency within the registration form where "Humanity Test" is not indicated with "required" field even though it is a required field.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Visit http://quality.mozilla.org/register
2.Scroll down to "Humanity Test"
3.Observe that there is no text as "(required)" indicating it as a required field
Actual Results:  
There is no "(required)" text in the bracket to indicate "Humanity Test" as required field.

Expected Results:  
Besides "Humanity Test" there should be "(required)" text in the brackets to indicate it as a required field and to maintain consistency which adds to usability quality criteria.
